page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The 4 x 3 km area lies immediately north-west of Dumfries. The River Cairn runs through the southern blocks, with the parish of Holywood to the north and a small part of Irongray parish south of the river. The river Nith touches the eastern side.Holywood is a rural area, with most of the land used in agriculture. The population of 532 is most dense in the south-east corner. Holywood Scheme is the main village with smaller hamlets being Newbridge, Old Holywood, Newington and East and West Cluden. The name "Holywood" (pronounced Hollywood) is traditionaly derived from a sacred grove of oaks known from earliest times.
